question:
You recently stayed with a childhood friend for a few days.
Write a letter to this friend. In your letter:
Thank your friend for letting you stay with them.
refer to something enjoyable that you did while staying with him/her
invite your friend to visit you
text: Hello, How are you. Hope you are in radiant health and best in spirit. It was a bewildering experience last month when i spent ten days at your place. I am writing to thank you and invite you to my place.

The way you treated me during my stay with you is really appreciable. I can never be a great host like you. I cherished every single day of my holidays. When we went to the 'Wonderland', I was simply mesmerized and those are unforgettable moments. We enjoyed everything there as if we were in our school days. I still remember the way you were afraid of water when you were a teenager, I guess you still are!

It would be a great pleasure to invite you to my home for my birthday next month. We will go to the nearby hill station and have great fun there. I will expect you to be with me at that time. Please try to make it.
I look forward to hear from you.

error_list.error_des: Consider using a question mark to signify that this sentence is a question.
The pronoun I should always be capitalized.
It seems that there is an article usage problem here.
The verb hear is usually in the gerund form when following the word look forward to. Consider replacing it with the -ing form.
